item.title: 195 – Goodnight, I love you, too
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Goodnight, I love you, too We talk around the dying fire. You’re a thousand miles away in Montana. I see the same full moon under the apple tree in our backyard but say nothing. We talk bills and the list … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Goodnight, I love you, too

We talk around the dying
fire. You’re a thousand miles away
in Montana.

I see the same full moon
under the apple tree in our backyard
but say nothing.

We talk bills
and the list of chores you left,
how the horses fare, the cat, the skin

and its loneliness in our big bed,
lost in the sweep of summer grass
under the Big Sky.

The wind is in your breathing, sound across
an empty bottle. The perfect center
of necessary nothing. The same in mine.

I long to dig out a coal, take it in my lips
and tell you of its burn and heat, the light
pouring out of my mouth.

But I don’t,
and wonder if I ever will,
or should.

item.title: 194 – Come unto me
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Come unto me I’ll destroy everything! The nightly fight at the house across the street. He means it, no kidding this time. Burn it all down. The fire of him melts the ice cream he so badly deserves. Everything! Like … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Come unto me

I’ll destroy everything!

The nightly fight
at the house
across the street.

He means it, no kidding
this time.
Burn it all down.

The fire of him melts
the ice cream
he so badly deserves.

Everything!

Like a good villain he negotiated
as long as he could before
implosion.

Stamping, screaming,
rattling every door
with tiny hands.

I hate everything, mama!

Is this what Jesus meant?
We laugh but who are we
kidding?

Later, when I finish
the wine or you change
the thermostat

we’ll melt down:
silently slamming
the dishwasher,

ignoring each other
as we brush teeth.
Epic. Less adult.

He flares up again
screaming bloody murder
in the name of Rocky Road.

Blisteringly honest
about what he wants,
he’s grounded,

sure, but at least
he won’t be spit
out.

item.title: 193 – hot hot heat
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: hot hot heat the heat muggles everything cat dog people brains say: splay in the basement bones soften thoughts sublimate mid-think to rivers frigid ice-block-yoga-pose DQ waitresses turn tyrant queens proffer wilted monies like the dead zinnias in parched gardens … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
hot hot heat

the heat muggles everything

cat dog people brains say: splay
in the basement

bones soften

thoughts sublimate mid-think
to rivers frigid ice-block-yoga-pose

DQ waitresses turn tyrant queens

proffer wilted monies
like the dead
zinnias in parched gardens

save us Arnold Palmer!

what terrible skinks we are
buying the last swamp cooler
with a smirk

eating every Otter Pop in the box

seat belt buckle burns fuck!

will we turn to jelly?
O little one–

what love pumps out
of overheated hearts

smearing aloe on sharked shoulders
frozen berries like marbles in the mouth

whisper-singing lie still little one

sun bungles down around
to bully another other

sleep off the heat

dream ice cream headache
dream toes in the mud

dream alabaster ointment
rainbow sno-cones syrup sweet
under-porch shadows

dream up a breeze
and grey-colored morning

dream your face
in a pool of cool water
leaking through the sieve
of your own fingers

item.title: 192 – extra nos
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.content:encoded: a caesura poem of Dietrich Bonhoeffer’s Life Together (pgs. 22-23)

item.title: 191 – Lord of morning
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Lord of morning You made first the cup Ceramic thrown by hand To hold heated bitter root On an old front porch Made pew and altar Witness to the rising Sound of no sound But leaf-stir soft Incantations of robin … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Lord of morning

You made first the cup
Ceramic thrown by hand
To hold heated bitter root
On an old front porch
Made pew and altar

Witness to the rising
Sound of no sound
But leaf-stir soft
Incantations of robin
Song and your children
Wondering aloud
What’s to come where
You might be guessed at

Flash of hummingbird floats ineffable
Before the potted nectar
Lanky mutt shakes himself awake
Worm turns the dirt in his slow passing
Cedar and the brewed herb
Rise to you, praise
And prayer of a new day
Robed in mystery

item.title: 190 – We named the dog Indiana
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: We named the dog Indiana It’s a song that creeps up when I’m alone in the jungle wedged onto a crowded bus each and anytime I bury my fists in my pockets like a lost treasure the pump house of … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
We named the dog Indiana

It’s a song that creeps up
when I’m alone in the jungle
wedged onto a crowded bus
each and anytime I bury my fists
in my pockets like a lost treasure
the pump house of my heart
slam-banging around the Octagon
humming a brass-backed melody to kill
the lurking savage bears or bees
or bears with bees in their mouths
A song to shout down demons on the bus
and put a smile all the way to the back
of your face whip your head around
dodge every poisoned arrow
and return the shrunken golden idol
to the altar from which it was plundered

item.title: 189 – Mapping
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Mapping The continent long mapped & circled in the fine line black of knowing. Altitudes. Forests. Barren wastes full of many hidden eyes. Each rock lifted, turned, named set back as a bone in its body. Salt and beetle, pungent … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Mapping

The continent long mapped & circled

in the fine line black of knowing.

Altitudes. Forests. Barren wastes

full of many hidden eyes.

Each rock lifted, turned, named

set back as a bone in its body.

Salt and beetle, pungent

loam, soft green papayas

fading toward rot.

Bird nests. Elk wallows. Mangrove swamps.

The shifting sand and skin of I,

crashing waves & cool winds,

the plate tectonics of I.

item.title: 188 – Cypriot
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Cypriot A Cypriot isn’t a stone fruit. Turkish turns tree to ağaç and el to hand. The island is five fingers banded by barbed smiles: kizma. Behind the blockade of teeth tongues squirm like waves like wet kisses puckering around … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Cypriot

A Cypriot isn’t a stone fruit.

Turkish turns
tree to ağaç
and el to hand.

The island is five fingers
banded by barbed smiles: kizma.

Behind the blockade of teeth
tongues squirm like waves

like wet kisses puckering

around the pit
at the center of sweetness.

item.title: 187 – Burial
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Burial We are too far south for ice floes. We’ve killed all the natives with our kindness. I set the totem of my troubles (all in pearl) on the burial skiff. Wreathed with weeds yellow eyes of daffodil blinking flame. … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Burial

We are too far south for ice floes.

We’ve killed all the natives with our kindness.

I set the totem of my troubles

(all in pearl) on the burial skiff.

Wreathed with weeds

yellow eyes of daffodil

blinking flame.

Early moon nests in the pines.

The sea is high

we shove her off

to bob until the waves come

scuttle her to the bottom

covered in seaweed

worshiped by what lurks there.

item.title: 186 – What the sea is
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: What the sea is unending sound curled conch of my ear tang lip locked lover Christ calmed with gentle steps lay down blues & green glass eye pitiless sky gives nothing back but you washed in sleep wake sand in … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
What the sea is

unending sound
curled

conch
of my ear

tang lip
locked lover

Christ calmed
with gentle steps

lay down blues
& green glass eye

pitiless sky
gives nothing

back
but you

washed in sleep
wake

sand in my eye
salt on my tongue
